poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: A rookery rout. The quorum of darkness in judgment. Pharmacological bends In his winter and summer white wine Till we at the requiem roust souvenirs, That he is the root of we can't pull by planting. The taurine voice is rooked, His dream home isn't roofed Yet, or bought, or the road to it Mapped. A cosy roost. Come and we'll sit in the kitchen.
